title: Checking Collinear Vectors Quiz
description: Test your ability to determine if vectors are collinear.

questions.question: What is the condition for two vectors to be collinear?
questions.explanation: Two vectors are collinear if their cross product is zero.

questions.question: Are vectors a=(2,4,6) and b=(1,2,3) collinear?
questions.explanation: The ratios are 2/1 = 4/2 = 6/3 = 2, so they are collinear.

questions.question: Which test is definitive for checking collinearity?
questions.explanation: The cross product being zero is the definitive test for collinearity.

questions.question: The zero vector is collinear with:
questions.explanation: The zero vector is collinear with all vectors since it can be expressed as a scalar multiple of any vector.

questions.question: Can two perpendicular non-zero vectors be collinear?
questions.explanation: Perpendicular vectors have a non-zero cross product, so they cannot be collinear.
